The only issue I have (which probably easily remedied) is trying to launch it with truffle test. i made a `launchGanche.js` that spawns the `ganache-cli` with parameters from a script in the package.json then runs `truffle test` but I was having issues with it shutting down correctly after the tests are done so now I just use a terminal window and start `ganache` in there, is there an easier way?

author: monkins
content:
I suppose this ok  for my development machine, but testers on cli will prob want to 
```bash
#!/bin/bash
source .env
ganache-cli -l 1500000000 ---account "$PRIVATE_KEY, 100000000000000000000" -p 8545 > "ganache.log" 2>&1 &
ganache_pid=$!
sleep 3
truffle test
kill $ganache_pid```
